Pre-Game Insights: The R.Premadasa Stadium in Colombo will host all three games of the series which kicks off on August 2.
India will take on Sri Lanka in a three-game ODI series after the Men in Blue whitewashed the hosts in the T20Is.
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will return to action under new head coach Gautam Gambhir for the very first time.
Charith Asalanka and the Lankans will look to avenge their T20I series loss and kick-start the ODIs on a winning note.
The R.Premadasa Stadium in Colombo has produced spin-friendly tracks where batters tend to struggle.
The average score of the venue is 256 in ODIs.
India will be the favourites to win the series with a stacked lineup full of world-beaters.
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli return to action for the first time after their T20I retirements and will be the key of the batting lineup against a tricky Lankan bowling attack.
Mohammed Siraj and Kuldeep Yadav will be the most important bowlers for India while others like Arshdeep Singh and Axar Patel will look to establish themselves in the 50-over format.
Sri Lanka will look for massive improvements after a disappointing performance in the T20I series.
Pathum Nissanka, Kusal Mendis, Sadeera Samarawickrama and Charith Asalanka will look to end the side batting woes evident in the T20Is.
Maheesh Theekshana and Matheesha Pathirana will be crucial for Sri Lanka while Dunith Wellalage and Asitha Fernando will look to support their strike bowlers.
